page.title: 02NATIONAL TRUST FOR SCOTLAND
page.content: The National Trust for Scotland (NTS) have owned the island since 1981. They are therefore the landowners and employers of the majority of the population. Everyone depends on them in some way. During the summer the NTS bring work parties of approximately 10 people who do various maintenance activities on the island and have a holiday at the same time. They stay in Tigh Ard for a small fee. Tigh Ard is also let for self_catering holidays. There is also a bothy that can sleep 6. Other summer visitors are people from visiting yachts who use the sheltered harbour and some campers. There are no facilities on the island for these people. In the winter there are few visitors to the island so the population remains stable.
